meanings.definition: Ponzus (noun): a type of financial scam in which returns are paid to earlier investors using the capital of newer investors.
meanings.sent1: The ponzus promised high returns but left many investors with nothing.
meanings.sent2: Investors lost their savings in a ponzus scheme.
meanings.sent3: The ponzus mastermind was finally caught by the authorities.
meanings.sent4: The ponzus unraveled, revealing the deceit behind the scheme.
meanings.sent5: Beware of falling for a ponzus; it can lead to financial ruin.

meanings.definition: Ponzus (verb): to engage in a fraudulent investment scheme similar to a Ponzi scheme.
meanings.sent1: He decided to ponzus unsuspecting individuals for personal gain.
meanings.sent2: She was arrested for attempting to ponzus innocent people.
meanings.sent3: Trying to ponzus others will only lead to trouble.
meanings.sent4: The con artist's plan was to ponzus as many victims as possible.
meanings.sent5: Ponzusing is illegal and unethical, so always be cautious with investments.
